title.narrative: Disaster Preparedness and response in Tanzania

description.narrative: Oxfam will continue to engage in the delivery of Water Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) & Emergency Food Security and Vulnerable Livelihoods (EFSVL) services for over 250,000 refugees settled in camps in Kasulu and Kibondo districts of Kigoma region and neighbouring host communities. In addition, Oxfam will be building capacity of local humanitarian actors (national staff, local Non Governmental Organisations (NGOs), district management committees, private sector and vulnerable communities) in disaster risk mapping, documentation and sharing of early warning information, development of institutions/community mechanisms for disaster resilience and better preparedness to respond and to take a leading role in humanitarian crises. This will target the refugee affected districts of Kibondo and Kasulu and 2 neighbouring districts in Mwanza region
